Posts.Content: My wife has an aggresive form of breast cancer,the last 12 months of my life have been hell,am trying to keep it together. My brother works for a mining company in Suriname,thats a country in South America.There are amerindians living there and there is something called grama(some sort of herb) that they use to treat cancer.My brother swears that it actually works and that allot of Cancer patients "really" get cured. I know there is allot of quackery out there and I do not want to get into big pharma conspiracy theory discussions.but what if? I know that the rain forest contains like a billion type of plants and these amerindians have been living there for thousands of years,much longer then our modern medical science,should i give it a try? or even consider it?
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: sandy, do you believe in your heart that there are alternative treatments that can cure my wife...thats the big question in my mind this thing with these amazon people is now my best chance
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: On Aug 19, 2016 12:13 AM sandyjulia wrote: I believe in my heart that alternative treatment in better, as to will it cure, only God has control of that.   My heart goes out to you your wife and your son... thanks............. I send them an email,will share the experience,hopefully others can find helpalso
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: On Aug 19, 2016 3:04 PM sandyjulia wrote: Oh I so hope so.  what stage cancer does your wife have inflamatory breast carcinoma is what the doctors are calling it
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: On Aug 19, 2016 12:41 AM sandyjulia wrote: sounds like a good plan, good luck, Sandy, I contacted them today and had a long chat with the young fellow,he was very rational and did not try to sound like a miracle worker. the stuff is quite pricey but I am placing my order in the morning,really hope it will works.
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: On Aug 19, 2016 3:04 PM sandyjulia wrote: Oh I so hope so.  what stage cancer does your wife have inflamatory breast carcinoma is what the doctors are calling it
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: On Aug 18, 2016 7:39 PM sandyjulia wrote: I say yes try it. much better than chemo which has been  proven that 93% of people do not benifit from it. I will get alot of flack for saying that, it is true.  The oncologists get a kick back for each patient that he prescribes to take it thanks sandyjulia, my son says we have to stick with modern medicine but I believe that we should be able to try additional methods. Interesting enough,I did allot of research on this particular tribe today and found that medical researchers have been investigating their medicinal plants for years. I found their website and phone #,the guy is clearly not an expert in building sites..but hey we are going to try it out and see,its called www.akuriowisdom.com .. please look and post advise
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: fear of her dying..is for me the scariest part,sometimes 4 days will go by without me shutting an eye.trying to blank out the thoughts.have become a zombie
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: thanks josie, my son is giving me really hard time,the last couple of days.He is reading all the medical journals and believes that the chemo will eventually kill off the cancer.I just want  extra options.. thats all
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: he is young and stubborn,these young kids think they know everything
Posts.Title: advice needed

Posts.Content: On Aug 19, 2016 7:34 PM sandyjulia wrote: ok,that is a agressive cancer, usually stage 111 or1V.  Says it is more common in Africian American woman.  I am sure you have researched it. Says one should consider seeing a doctor who specializes in that particular cancer.  Have you also considered Clinical Trials, that too is highly recommended for such.  You can call NCI national cancer Institute 1 800-4-cancer.   Again, thoughts with you all.... Here is you need to talk.  Sandy  she is indeed 1/8th african american from her mothers side,dont really know allot about all the relevant medical terms,but I am learning.We got a bunch of leaflets and i am starting to read some.Its just been so heavy and so devastating..I appreciate just being able to talk here
